place.name: BOULTHAM
place.gazetteerText: BOULTHAM, a parish in the district and county of Lincoln; on the river Witham, the Roman road, and the Midland railway, 2 miles SSW of Lincoln. Postown, Lincoln. Acres, 1,210. Real property, £2,348 op., 95. Houses, 20. The property is divided among few. Boultham Hall is a chief residence. The living s a rectory in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £126. Patron, R. Ellison, Esq. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
